name: separative
content:

relating to or causing separation: Many humans have a separative instinct during times of stress, wanting to run away from the problem. The armrest is a separative device to keep you and your seatmate comfortable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe plant forms a separative layer that keeps rot from spreading to the bark and killing the plant. The lack of workplace facilities gave the parents no alternative but separative childcare.They were sentenced to separative confinement in cells because of their behaviour.
